People not just protesting, but setting up show trials and dragging administrators to explain fake scores. That’s what happens when the truth gets forced out.
I read some of those internal files—they were never supposed to escape audit buffers. Didn’t match what we were told for years.
Some of my colleagues quietly help citizens ‘disappear’ off system ledgers. Now nobody knows what will show up from day to day.
I backed Innovators on Council, thought more oversight would mean fewer cracks, fewer people like my brother lost after audits.
But it’s clear now: the system’s too rigid, everything’s connected, but nothing’s accountable. People with low scores suddenly running key grids, some top scorers locked out entirely.
I think Halden’s death ripped out the last safety net.
Honestly, if you want real stability, they need to redesign from the foundations, not just patch the leak.
